57// ***************************************************************************
58// Structures
59
60// We keep a list of client-supplied event sources in PosixEventSource records
61struct PosixEventSource
62{
63 mDNSPosixEventCallback Callback;
64 void *Context;
65 int fd;
66 struct PosixEventSource *Next;
67};
68typedef struct PosixEventSource PosixEventSource;
69
70// Context record for interface change callback
71struct IfChangeRec
72{
73 int NotifySD;
74 mDNS *mDNS;
75};
76typedef struct IfChangeRec IfChangeRec;
77
78// Note that static data is initialized to zero in (modern) C.
79static fd_set gEventFDs;
80static int gMaxFD; // largest fd in gEventFDs
81static GenLinkedList gEventSources; // linked list of PosixEventSource's
82static sigset_t gEventSignalSet; // Signals which event loop listens for
83static sigset_t gEventSignals; // Signals which were received while inside loop
84
85static PosixNetworkInterface *gRecentInterfaces;
86
87// ***************************************************************************
88// Globals (for debugging)
89
90static int num_registered_interfaces = 0;
91static int num_pkts_accepted = 0;
92static int num_pkts_rejected = 0;
93
94// ***************************************************************************
95// Functions
96
97int gMDNSPlatformPosixVerboseLevel = 0;
98
99#define PosixErrorToStatus(errNum) ((errNum) == 0 ? mStatus_NoError : mStatus_UnknownErr)
100
101mDNSlocal void SockAddrTomDNSAddr(const struct sockaddr *const sa, mDNSAddr *ipAddr, mDNSIPPort *ipPort)
102{
103 switch (sa->sa_family)
104 {
105 case AF_INET:
106 {
107 struct sockaddr_in *sin = (struct sockaddr_in*)sa;
108 ipAddr->type = mDNSAddrType_IPv4;
109 ipAddr->ip.v4.NotAnInteger = sin->sin_addr.s_addr;
110 if (ipPort) ipPort->NotAnInteger = sin->sin_port;
111 break;
112 }
113
114#if HAVE_IPV6
115 case AF_INET6:
116 {
117 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6 = (struct sockaddr_in6*)sa;
118#ifndef NOT_HAVE_SA_LEN
119 assert(sin6->sin6_len == sizeof(*sin6));
120#endif
121 ipAddr->type = mDNSAddrType_IPv6;
122 ipAddr->ip.v6 = *(mDNSv6Addr*)&sin6->sin6_addr;
123 if (ipPort) ipPort->NotAnInteger = sin6->sin6_port;
124 break;
125 }
126#endif
127
128 default:
129 verbosedebugf("SockAddrTomDNSAddr: Uknown address family %d\n", sa->sa_family);
130 ipAddr->type = mDNSAddrType_None;
131 if (ipPort) ipPort->NotAnInteger = 0;
132 break;
133 }
134}
135
136#if COMPILER_LIKES_PRAGMA_MARK
137#pragma mark ***** Send and Receive
138#endif
139
140// mDNS core calls this routine when it needs to send a packet.
141mDNSexport mStatus mDNSPlatformSendUDP(const mDNS *const m, const void *const msg, const mDNSu8 *const end,
142 mDNSInterfaceID InterfaceID, UDPSocket *src, const mDNSAddr *dst,
143 mDNSIPPort dstPort, mDNSBool useBackgroundTrafficClass)
144{
145 int err = 0;
146 struct sockaddr_storage to;
147 PosixNetworkInterface * thisIntf = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(InterfaceID);
148 int sendingsocket = -1;
149
150 (void)src; // Will need to use this parameter once we implement mDNSPlatformUDPSocket/mDNSPlatformUDPClose
151 (void) useBackgroundTrafficClass;
152
153 assert(m != NULL);
154 assert(msg != NULL);
155 assert(end != NULL);
156 assert((((char *) end) - ((char *) msg)) > 0);
157
158 if (dstPort.NotAnInteger == 0)
159 {
160 LogMsg("mDNSPlatformSendUDP: Invalid argument -dstPort is set to 0");
161 return PosixErrorToStatus(EINVAL);
162 }
163 if (dst->type == mDNSAddrType_IPv4)
164 {
165 struct sockaddr_in *sin = (struct sockaddr_in*)&to;
166#ifndef NOT_HAVE_SA_LEN
167 sin->sin_len = sizeof(*sin);
168#endif
169 sin->sin_family = AF_INET;
170 sin->sin_port = dstPort.NotAnInteger;
171 sin->sin_addr.s_addr = dst->ip.v4.NotAnInteger;
172 sendingsocket = thisIntf ? thisIntf->multicastSocket4 : m->p->unicastSocket4;
173 }
174
175#if HAVE_IPV6
176 else if (dst->type == mDNSAddrType_IPv6)
177 {
178 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6 = (struct sockaddr_in6*)&to;
179 mDNSPlatformMemZero(sin6, sizeof(*sin6));
180#ifndef NOT_HAVE_SA_LEN
181 sin6->sin6_len = sizeof(*sin6);
182#endif
183 sin6->sin6_family = AF_INET6;
184 sin6->sin6_port = dstPort.NotAnInteger;
185 sin6->sin6_addr = *(struct in6_addr*)&dst->ip.v6;
186 sendingsocket = thisIntf ? thisIntf->multicastSocket6 : m->p->unicastSocket6;
187 }
188#endif
189
190 if (sendingsocket >= 0)
191 err = sendto(sendingsocket, msg, (char*)end - (char*)msg, 0, (struct sockaddr *)&to, GET_SA_LEN(to));
192
193 if (err > 0) err = 0;
194 else if (err < 0)
195 {
196 static int MessageCount = 0;
197 // Don't report EHOSTDOWN (i.e. ARP failure), ENETDOWN, or no route to host for unicast destinations
198 if (!mDNSAddressIsAllDNSLinkGroup(dst))
199 if (errno == EHOSTDOWN || errno == ENETDOWN || errno == EHOSTUNREACH || errno == ENETUNREACH) return(mStatus_TransientErr);
200
201 if (MessageCount < 1000)
202 {
203 MessageCount++;
204 if (thisIntf)
205 LogMsg("mDNSPlatformSendUDP got error %d (%s) sending packet to %#a on interface %#a/%s/%d",
206 errno, strerror(errno), dst, &thisIntf->coreIntf.ip, thisIntf->intfName, thisIntf->index);
207 else
208 LogMsg("mDNSPlatformSendUDP got error %d (%s) sending packet to %#a", errno, strerror(errno), dst);
209 }
210 }
211
212 return PosixErrorToStatus(err);
213}
214
215// This routine is called when the main loop detects that data is available on a socket.
216mDNSlocal void SocketDataReady(mDNS *const m, PosixNetworkInterface *intf, int skt)
217{
218 mDNSAddr senderAddr, destAddr;
219 mDNSIPPort senderPort;
220 ssize_t packetLen;
221 DNSMessage packet;
222 struct my_in_pktinfo packetInfo;
223 struct sockaddr_storage from;
224 socklen_t fromLen;
225 int flags;
226 mDNSu8 ttl;
227 mDNSBool reject;
228 const mDNSInterfaceID InterfaceID = intf ? intf->coreIntf.InterfaceID : NULL;
229
230 assert(m != NULL);
231 assert(skt >= 0);
232
233 fromLen = sizeof(from);
234 flags = 0;
235 packetLen = recvfrom_flags(skt, &packet, sizeof(packet), &flags, (struct sockaddr *) &from, &fromLen, &packetInfo, &ttl);
236
237 if (packetLen >= 0)
238 {
239 SockAddrTomDNSAddr((struct sockaddr*)&from, &senderAddr, &senderPort);
240 SockAddrTomDNSAddr((struct sockaddr*)&packetInfo.ipi_addr, &destAddr, NULL);
241
242 // If we have broken IP_RECVDSTADDR functionality (so far
243 // I've only seen this on OpenBSD) then apply a hack to
244 // convince mDNS Core that this isn't a spoof packet.
245 // Basically what we do is check to see whether the
246 // packet arrived as a multicast and, if so, set its
247 // destAddr to the mDNS address.
248 //
249 // I must admit that I could just be doing something
250 // wrong on OpenBSD and hence triggering this problem
251 // but I'm at a loss as to how.
252 //
253 // If this platform doesn't have IP_PKTINFO or IP_RECVDSTADDR, then we have
254 // no way to tell the destination address or interface this packet arrived on,
255 // so all we can do is just assume it's a multicast
256
257 #if HAVE_BROKEN_RECVDSTADDR || (!defined(IP_PKTINFO) && !defined(IP_RECVDSTADDR))
258 if ((destAddr.NotAnInteger == 0) && (flags & MSG_MCAST))
259 {
260 destAddr.type = senderAddr.type;
261 if (senderAddr.type == mDNSAddrType_IPv4) destAddr.ip.v4 = AllDNSLinkGroup_v4.ip.v4;
262 else if (senderAddr.type == mDNSAddrType_IPv6) destAddr.ip.v6 = AllDNSLinkGroup_v6.ip.v6;
263 }
264 #endif
265
266 // We only accept the packet if the interface on which it came
267 // in matches the interface associated with this socket.
268 // We do this match by name or by index, depending on which
269 // information is available. recvfrom_flags sets the name
270 // to "" if the name isn't available, or the index to -1
271 // if the index is available. This accomodates the various
272 // different capabilities of our target platforms.
273
274 reject = mDNSfalse;
275 if (!intf)
276 {
277 // Ignore multicasts accidentally delivered to our unicast receiving socket
278 if (mDNSAddrIsDNSMulticast(&destAddr)) packetLen = -1;
279 }
280 else
281 {
282 if (packetInfo.ipi_ifname[0] != 0) reject = (strcmp(packetInfo.ipi_ifname, intf->intfName) != 0);
283 else if (packetInfo.ipi_ifindex != -1) reject = (packetInfo.ipi_ifindex != intf->index);
284
285 if (reject)
286 {
287 verbosedebugf("SocketDataReady ignored a packet from %#a to %#a on interface %s/%d expecting %#a/%s/%d/%d",
288 &senderAddr, &destAddr, packetInfo.ipi_ifname, packetInfo.ipi_ifindex,
289 &intf->coreIntf.ip, intf->intfName, intf->index, skt);
290 packetLen = -1;
291 num_pkts_rejected++;
292 if (num_pkts_rejected > (num_pkts_accepted + 1) * (num_registered_interfaces + 1) * 2)
293 {
294 fprintf(stderr,
295 "*** WARNING: Received %d packets; Accepted %d packets; Rejected %d packets because of interface mismatch\n",
296 num_pkts_accepted + num_pkts_rejected, num_pkts_accepted, num_pkts_rejected);
297 num_pkts_accepted = 0;
298 num_pkts_rejected = 0;
299 }
300 }
301 else
302 {
303 verbosedebugf("SocketDataReady got a packet from %#a to %#a on interface %#a/%s/%d/%d",
304 &senderAddr, &destAddr, &intf->coreIntf.ip, intf->intfName, intf->index, skt);
305 num_pkts_accepted++;
306 }
307 }
308 }
309
310 if (packetLen >= 0)
311 mDNSCoreReceive(m, &packet, (mDNSu8 *)&packet + packetLen,
312 &senderAddr, senderPort, &destAddr, MulticastDNSPort, InterfaceID);
313}

465// This gets the current hostname, truncating it at the first dot if necessary
466mDNSlocal void GetUserSpecifiedRFC1034ComputerName(domainlabel *const namelabel)
467{
468 int len = 0;
469 gethostname((char *)(&namelabel->c[1]), MAX_DOMAIN_LABEL);
470 while (len < MAX_DOMAIN_LABEL && namelabel->c[len+1] && namelabel->c[len+1] != '.') len++;
471 namelabel->c[0] = len;
472}
473
474// On OS X this gets the text of the field labelled "Computer Name" in the Sharing Prefs Control Panel
475// Other platforms can either get the information from the appropriate place,
476// or they can alternatively just require all registering services to provide an explicit name
477mDNSlocal void GetUserSpecifiedFriendlyComputerName(domainlabel *const namelabel)
478{
479 // On Unix we have no better name than the host name, so we just use that.
480 GetUserSpecifiedRFC1034ComputerName(namelabel);
481}
482
483mDNSexport int ParseDNSServers(mDNS *m, const char *filePath)
484{
485 char line[256];
486 char nameserver[16];
487 char keyword[11];
488 int numOfServers = 0;
489 FILE *fp = fopen(filePath, "r");
490 if (fp == NULL) return -1;
491 while (fgets(line,sizeof(line),fp))
492 {
493 struct in_addr ina;
494 struct in6_addr ina6;
495 line[255]='\0'; // just to be safe
496 if (sscanf(line,"%10s %15s", keyword, nameserver) != 2) continue; // it will skip whitespaces
497 if (strncasecmp(keyword,"nameserver",10)) continue;
498 if (inet_pton(AF_INET, nameserver, &ina) == 1)
499 {
500 mDNSAddr DNSAddr;
501 DNSAddr.type = mDNSAddrType_IPv4;
502 DNSAddr.ip.v4.NotAnInteger = ina.s_addr;
503 mDNS_AddDNSServer(m, NULL, mDNSInterface_Any, 0, &DNSAddr, UnicastDNSPort, kScopeNone, 0, mDNSfalse, mDNSfalse, 0, mDNStrue, mDNStrue, mDNSfalse);
504 numOfServers++;
505 }
506 else if (inet_pton(AF_INET6, nameserver, &ina6) == 1)
507 {
508 mDNSAddr DNSAddr;
509 DNSAddr.type = mDNSAddrType_IPv6;
510 DNSAddr.ip.v6 = *(mDNSv6Addr *)&ina6;
511 mDNS_AddDNSServer(m, NULL, mDNSInterface_Any, 0, &DNSAddr, UnicastDNSPort, kScopeNone, 0, mDNSfalse, mDNSfalse, 0, mDNStrue, mDNStrue, mDNSfalse);
512 numOfServers++;
513 }
514 }
515 fclose(fp);
516 return (numOfServers > 0) ? 0 : -1;
517}
518
519// Searches the interface list looking for the named interface.
520// Returns a pointer to if it found, or NULL otherwise.
521mDNSlocal PosixNetworkInterface *SearchForInterfaceByName(mDNS *const m, const char *intfName)
522{
523 PosixNetworkInterface *intf;
524
525 assert(m != NULL);
526 assert(intfName != NULL);
527
528 intf = (PosixNetworkInterface*)(m->HostInterfaces);
529 while ((intf != NULL) && (strcmp(intf->intfName, intfName) != 0))
530 intf = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(intf->coreIntf.next);
531
532 return intf;
533}
534
535mDNSexport mDNSInterfaceID mDNSPlatformInterfaceIDfromInterfaceIndex(mDNS *const m, mDNSu32 index)
536{
537 PosixNetworkInterface *intf;
538
539 assert(m != NULL);
540
541 if (index == kDNSServiceInterfaceIndexLocalOnly) return(mDNSInterface_LocalOnly);
542 if (index == kDNSServiceInterfaceIndexP2P ) return(mDNSInterface_P2P);
543 if (index == kDNSServiceInterfaceIndexAny ) return(mDNSInterface_Any);
544
545 intf = (PosixNetworkInterface*)(m->HostInterfaces);
546 while ((intf != NULL) && (mDNSu32) intf->index != index)
547 intf = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(intf->coreIntf.next);
548
549 return (mDNSInterfaceID) intf;
550}
551
552mDNSexport mDNSu32 mDNSPlatformInterfaceIndexfromInterfaceID(mDNS *const m, mDNSInterfaceID id, mDNSBool suppressNetworkChange)
553{
554 PosixNetworkInterface *intf;
555 (void) suppressNetworkChange; // Unused
556
557 assert(m != NULL);
558
559 if (id == mDNSInterface_LocalOnly) return(kDNSServiceInterfaceIndexLocalOnly);
560 if (id == mDNSInterface_P2P ) return(kDNSServiceInterfaceIndexP2P);
561 if (id == mDNSInterface_Any ) return(kDNSServiceInterfaceIndexAny);
562
563 intf = (PosixNetworkInterface*)(m->HostInterfaces);
564 while ((intf != NULL) && (mDNSInterfaceID) intf != id)
565 intf = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(intf->coreIntf.next);
566
567 if (intf) return intf->index;
568
569 // If we didn't find the interface, check the RecentInterfaces list as well
570 intf = gRecentInterfaces;
571 while ((intf != NULL) && (mDNSInterfaceID) intf != id)
572 intf = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(intf->coreIntf.next);
573
574 return intf ? intf->index : 0;
575}
576
577// Frees the specified PosixNetworkInterface structure. The underlying
578// interface must have already been deregistered with the mDNS core.
579mDNSlocal void FreePosixNetworkInterface(PosixNetworkInterface *intf)
580{
581 int rv;
582 assert(intf != NULL);
583 if (intf->intfName != NULL) free((void *)intf->intfName);
584 if (intf->multicastSocket4 != -1)
585 {
586 rv = close(intf->multicastSocket4);
587 assert(rv == 0);
588 }
589#if HAVE_IPV6
590 if (intf->multicastSocket6 != -1)
591 {
592 rv = close(intf->multicastSocket6);
593 assert(rv == 0);
594 }
595#endif
596
597 // Move interface to the RecentInterfaces list for a minute
598 intf->LastSeen = mDNSPlatformUTC();
599 intf->coreIntf.next = &gRecentInterfaces->coreIntf;
600 gRecentInterfaces = intf;
601}
602
603// Grab the first interface, deregister it, free it, and repeat until done.
604mDNSlocal void ClearInterfaceList(mDNS *const m)
605{
606 assert(m != NULL);
607
608 while (m->HostInterfaces)
609 {
610 PosixNetworkInterface *intf = (PosixNetworkInterface*)(m->HostInterfaces);
611 mDNS_DeregisterInterface(m, &intf->coreIntf, NormalActivation);
612 if (gMDNSPlatformPosixVerboseLevel > 0) fprintf(stderr, "Deregistered interface %s\n", intf->intfName);
613 FreePosixNetworkInterface(intf);
614 }
615 num_registered_interfaces = 0;
616 num_pkts_accepted = 0;
617 num_pkts_rejected = 0;
618}
619
620// Sets up a send/receive socket.
621// If mDNSIPPort port is non-zero, then it's a multicast socket on the specified interface
622// If mDNSIPPort port is zero, then it's a randomly assigned port number, used for sending unicast queries
623mDNSlocal int SetupSocket(struct sockaddr *intfAddr, mDNSIPPort port, int interfaceIndex, int *sktPtr)
624{
625 int err = 0;
626 static const int kOn = 1;
627 static const int kIntTwoFiveFive = 255;
628 static const unsigned char kByteTwoFiveFive = 255;
629 const mDNSBool JoinMulticastGroup = (port.NotAnInteger != 0);
630
631 (void) interfaceIndex; // This parameter unused on plaforms that don't have IPv6
632 assert(intfAddr != NULL);
633 assert(sktPtr != NULL);
634 assert(*sktPtr == -1);
635
636 // Open the socket...
637 if (intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET) *sktPtr = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
638#if HAVE_IPV6
639 else if (intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET6) *sktPtr = socket(PF_INET6, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
640#endif
641 else return EINVAL;
642
643 if (*sktPtr < 0) { err = errno; perror((intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET) ? "socket AF_INET" : "socket AF_INET6"); }
644
645 // ... with a shared UDP port, if it's for multicast receiving
646 if (err == 0 && port.NotAnInteger)
647 {
648 // <rdar://problem/20946253>
649 // We test for SO_REUSEADDR first, as suggested by Jonny Törnbom from Axis Communications
650 // Linux kernel versions 3.9 introduces support for socket option
651 // SO_REUSEPORT, however this is not implemented the same as on *BSD
652 // systems. Linux version implements a "port hijacking" prevention
653 // mechanism, limiting processes wanting to bind to an already existing
654 // addr:port to have the same effective UID as the first who bound it. What
655 // this meant for us was that the daemon ran as one user and when for
656 // instance mDNSClientPosix was executed by another user, it wasn't allowed
657 // to bind to the socket. Our suggestion was to switch the order in which
658 // SO_REUSEPORT and SO_REUSEADDR was tested so that SO_REUSEADDR stays on
659 // top and SO_REUSEPORT to be used only if SO_REUSEADDR doesn't exist.
660 #if defined(SO_REUSEADDR) && !defined(__MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED) && !defined(__NetBSD__)
661 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
662 #elif defined(SO_REUSEPORT)
663 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEPORT, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
664 #else
665 #error This platform has no way to avoid address busy errors on multicast.
666 #endif
667 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - SO_REUSExxxx"); }
668
669#ifndef __NetBSD__
670 // Enable inbound packets on IFEF_AWDL interface.
671 // Only done for multicast sockets, since we don't expect unicast socket operations
672 // on the IFEF_AWDL interface. Operation is a no-op for other interface types.
673 #ifndef SO_RECV_ANYIF
674 #define SO_RECV_ANYIF 0x1104 /* unrestricted inbound processing */
675 #endif
676 if (setsockopt(*sktPtr, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RECV_ANYIF, &kOn, sizeof(kOn)) < 0) perror("setsockopt - SO_RECV_ANYIF");
677#endif
678 }
679
680 // We want to receive destination addresses and interface identifiers.
681 if (intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET)
682 {
683 struct ip_mreq imr;
684 struct sockaddr_in bindAddr;
685 if (err == 0)
686 {
687 #if defined(IP_PKTINFO) // Linux
688 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_PKTINFO, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
689 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IP_PKTINFO"); }
690 #elif defined(IP_RECVDSTADDR) || defined(IP_RECVIF) // BSD and Solaris
691 #if defined(IP_RECVDSTADDR)
692 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_RECVDSTADDR, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
693 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IP_RECVDSTADDR"); }
694 #endif
695 #if defined(IP_RECVIF)
696 if (err == 0)
697 {
698 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_RECVIF, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
699 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IP_RECVIF"); }
700 }
701 #endif
702 #else
703 #warning This platform has no way to get the destination interface information -- will only work for single-homed hosts
704 #endif
705 }
706 #if defined(IP_RECVTTL) // Linux
707 if (err == 0)
708 {
709 setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_RECVTTL, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
710 // We no longer depend on being able to get the received TTL, so don't worry if the option fails
711 }
712 #endif
713
714 // Add multicast group membership on this interface
715 if (err == 0 && JoinMulticastGroup)
716 {
717 imr.imr_multiaddr.s_addr = AllDNSLinkGroup_v4.ip.v4.NotAnInteger;
718 imr.imr_interface = ((struct sockaddr_in*)intfAddr)->sin_addr;
719 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP, &imr, sizeof(imr));
720 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP"); }
721 }
722
723 // Specify outgoing interface too
724 if (err == 0 && JoinMulticastGroup)
725 {
726 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_MULTICAST_IF, &((struct sockaddr_in*)intfAddr)->sin_addr, sizeof(struct in_addr));
727 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IP_MULTICAST_IF"); }
728 }
729
730 // Per the mDNS spec, send unicast packets with TTL 255
731 if (err == 0)
732 {
733 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_TTL, &kIntTwoFiveFive, sizeof(kIntTwoFiveFive));
734 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IP_TTL"); }
735 }
736
737 // and multicast packets with TTL 255 too
738 // There's some debate as to whether IP_MULTICAST_TTL is an int or a byte so we just try both.
739 if (err == 0)
740 {
741 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_MULTICAST_TTL, &kByteTwoFiveFive, sizeof(kByteTwoFiveFive));
742 if (err < 0 && errno == EINVAL)
743 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IP, IP_MULTICAST_TTL, &kIntTwoFiveFive, sizeof(kIntTwoFiveFive));
744 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IP_MULTICAST_TTL"); }
745 }
746
747 // And start listening for packets
748 if (err == 0)
749 {
750 mDNSPlatformMemZero(&bindAddr, sizeof(bindAddr));
751#ifndef NOT_HAVE_SA_LEN
752 bindAddr.sin_len = sizeof(bindAddr);
753#endif
754 bindAddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
755 bindAddr.sin_port = port.NotAnInteger;
756 bindAddr.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY; // Want to receive multicasts AND unicasts on this socket
757 err = bind(*sktPtr, (struct sockaddr *) &bindAddr, sizeof(bindAddr));
758 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("bind"); fflush(stderr); }
759 }
760 } // endif (intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET)
761
762#if HAVE_IPV6
763 else if (intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET6)
764 {
765 struct ipv6_mreq imr6;
766 struct sockaddr_in6 bindAddr6;
767 #if defined(IPV6_PKTINFO)
768 if (err == 0)
769 {
770 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_2292_PKTINFO, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
771 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IPV6_PKTINFO"); }
772 }
773 #else
774 #warning This platform has no way to get the destination interface information for IPv6 -- will only work for single-homed hosts
775 #endif
776 #if defined(IPV6_HOPLIMIT)
777 if (err == 0)
778 {
779 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_2292_HOPLIMIT, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
780 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IPV6_HOPLIMIT"); }
781 }
782 #endif
783
784 // Add multicast group membership on this interface
785 if (err == 0 && JoinMulticastGroup)
786 {
787 imr6.ipv6mr_multiaddr = *(const struct in6_addr*)&AllDNSLinkGroup_v6.ip.v6;
788 imr6.ipv6mr_interface = interfaceIndex;
789 //LogMsg("Joining %.16a on %d", &imr6.ipv6mr_multiaddr, imr6.ipv6mr_interface);
790 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_JOIN_GROUP, &imr6, sizeof(imr6));
791 if (err < 0)
792 {
793 err = errno;
794 verbosedebugf("IPV6_JOIN_GROUP %.16a on %d failed.\n", &imr6.ipv6mr_multiaddr, imr6.ipv6mr_interface);
795 perror("setsockopt - IPV6_JOIN_GROUP");
796 }
797 }
798
799 // Specify outgoing interface too
800 if (err == 0 && JoinMulticastGroup)
801 {
802 u_int multicast_if = interfaceIndex;
803 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_MULTICAST_IF, &multicast_if, sizeof(multicast_if));
804 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IPV6_MULTICAST_IF"); }
805 }
806
807 // We want to receive only IPv6 packets on this socket.
808 // Without this option, we may get IPv4 addresses as mapped addresses.
809 if (err == 0)
810 {
811 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_V6ONLY, &kOn, sizeof(kOn));
812 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IPV6_V6ONLY"); }
813 }
814
815 // Per the mDNS spec, send unicast packets with TTL 255
816 if (err == 0)
817 {
818 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_UNICAST_HOPS, &kIntTwoFiveFive, sizeof(kIntTwoFiveFive));
819 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IPV6_UNICAST_HOPS"); }
820 }
821
822 // and multicast packets with TTL 255 too
823 // There's some debate as to whether IPV6_MULTICAST_HOPS is an int or a byte so we just try both.
824 if (err == 0)
825 {
826 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_MULTICAST_HOPS, &kByteTwoFiveFive, sizeof(kByteTwoFiveFive));
827 if (err < 0 && errno == EINVAL)
828 err = setsockopt(*sktPtr, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_MULTICAST_HOPS, &kIntTwoFiveFive, sizeof(kIntTwoFiveFive));
829 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("setsockopt - IPV6_MULTICAST_HOPS"); }
830 }
831
832 // And start listening for packets
833 if (err == 0)
834 {
835 mDNSPlatformMemZero(&bindAddr6, sizeof(bindAddr6));
836#ifndef NOT_HAVE_SA_LEN
837 bindAddr6.sin6_len = sizeof(bindAddr6);
838#endif
839 bindAddr6.sin6_family = AF_INET6;
840 bindAddr6.sin6_port = port.NotAnInteger;
841 bindAddr6.sin6_flowinfo = 0;
842 bindAddr6.sin6_addr = in6addr_any; // Want to receive multicasts AND unicasts on this socket
843 bindAddr6.sin6_scope_id = 0;
844 err = bind(*sktPtr, (struct sockaddr *) &bindAddr6, sizeof(bindAddr6));
845 if (err < 0) { err = errno; perror("bind"); fflush(stderr); }
846 }
847 } // endif (intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET6)
848#endif
849
850 // Set the socket to non-blocking.
851 if (err == 0)
852 {
853 err = fcntl(*sktPtr, F_GETFL, 0);
854 if (err < 0) err = errno;
855 else
856 {
857 err = fcntl(*sktPtr, F_SETFL, err | O_NONBLOCK);
858 if (err < 0) err = errno;
859 }
860 }
861
862 // Clean up
863 if (err != 0 && *sktPtr != -1)
864 {
865 int rv;
866 rv = close(*sktPtr);
867 assert(rv == 0);
868 *sktPtr = -1;
869 }
870 assert((err == 0) == (*sktPtr != -1));
871 return err;
872}
873
874// Creates a PosixNetworkInterface for the interface whose IP address is
875// intfAddr and whose name is intfName and registers it with mDNS core.
876mDNSlocal int SetupOneInterface(mDNS *const m, struct sockaddr *intfAddr, struct sockaddr *intfMask, const char *intfName, int intfIndex)
877{
878 int err = 0;
879 PosixNetworkInterface *intf;
880 PosixNetworkInterface *alias = NULL;
881
882 assert(m != NULL);
883 assert(intfAddr != NULL);
884 assert(intfName != NULL);
885 assert(intfMask != NULL);
886
887 // Allocate the interface structure itself.
888 intf = (PosixNetworkInterface*)calloc(1, sizeof(*intf));
889 if (intf == NULL) { assert(0); err = ENOMEM; }
890
891 // And make a copy of the intfName.
892 if (err == 0)
893 {
894 intf->intfName = strdup(intfName);
895 if (intf->intfName == NULL) { assert(0); err = ENOMEM; }
896 }
897
898 if (err == 0)
899 {
900 // Set up the fields required by the mDNS core.
901 SockAddrTomDNSAddr(intfAddr, &intf->coreIntf.ip, NULL);
902 SockAddrTomDNSAddr(intfMask, &intf->coreIntf.mask, NULL);
903
904 //LogMsg("SetupOneInterface: %#a %#a", &intf->coreIntf.ip, &intf->coreIntf.mask);
905 strncpy(intf->coreIntf.ifname, intfName, sizeof(intf->coreIntf.ifname));
906 intf->coreIntf.ifname[sizeof(intf->coreIntf.ifname)-1] = 0;
907 intf->coreIntf.Advertise = m->AdvertiseLocalAddresses;
908 intf->coreIntf.McastTxRx = mDNStrue;
909
910 // Set up the extra fields in PosixNetworkInterface.
911 assert(intf->intfName != NULL); // intf->intfName already set up above
912 intf->index = intfIndex;
913 intf->multicastSocket4 = -1;
914#if HAVE_IPV6
915 intf->multicastSocket6 = -1;
916#endif
917 alias = SearchForInterfaceByName(m, intf->intfName);
918 if (alias == NULL) alias = intf;
919 intf->coreIntf.InterfaceID = (mDNSInterfaceID)alias;
920
921 if (alias != intf)
922 debugf("SetupOneInterface: %s %#a is an alias of %#a", intfName, &intf->coreIntf.ip, &alias->coreIntf.ip);
923 }
924
925 // Set up the multicast socket
926 if (err == 0)
927 {
928 if (alias->multicastSocket4 == -1 && intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET)
929 err = SetupSocket(intfAddr, MulticastDNSPort, intf->index, &alias->multicastSocket4);
930#if HAVE_IPV6
931 else if (alias->multicastSocket6 == -1 && intfAddr->sa_family == AF_INET6)
932 err = SetupSocket(intfAddr, MulticastDNSPort, intf->index, &alias->multicastSocket6);
933#endif
934 }
935
936 // If interface is a direct link, address record will be marked as kDNSRecordTypeKnownUnique
937 // and skip the probe phase of the probe/announce packet sequence.
938 intf->coreIntf.DirectLink = mDNSfalse;
939#ifdef DIRECTLINK_INTERFACE_NAME
940 if (strcmp(intfName, STRINGIFY(DIRECTLINK_INTERFACE_NAME)) == 0)
941 intf->coreIntf.DirectLink = mDNStrue;
942#endif
943 intf->coreIntf.SupportsUnicastMDNSResponse = mDNStrue;
944
945 // The interface is all ready to go, let's register it with the mDNS core.
946 if (err == 0)
947 err = mDNS_RegisterInterface(m, &intf->coreIntf, NormalActivation);
948
949 // Clean up.
950 if (err == 0)
951 {
952 num_registered_interfaces++;
953 debugf("SetupOneInterface: %s %#a Registered", intf->intfName, &intf->coreIntf.ip);
954 if (gMDNSPlatformPosixVerboseLevel > 0)
955 fprintf(stderr, "Registered interface %s\n", intf->intfName);
956 }
957 else
958 {
959 // Use intfName instead of intf->intfName in the next line to avoid dereferencing NULL.
960 debugf("SetupOneInterface: %s %#a failed to register %d", intfName, &intf->coreIntf.ip, err);
961 if (intf) { FreePosixNetworkInterface(intf); intf = NULL; }
962 }
963
964 assert((err == 0) == (intf != NULL));
965
966 return err;
967}
968
969// Call get_ifi_info() to obtain a list of active interfaces and call SetupOneInterface() on each one.
970mDNSlocal int SetupInterfaceList(mDNS *const m)
971{
972 mDNSBool foundav4 = mDNSfalse;
973 int err = 0;
974 struct ifi_info *intfList = get_ifi_info(AF_INET, mDNStrue);
975 struct ifi_info *firstLoopback = NULL;
976
977 assert(m != NULL);
978 debugf("SetupInterfaceList");
979
980#if 0
981 if (intfList == NULL) err = ENOENT;
982#endif
983
984#if HAVE_IPV6
985 if (err == 0) /* Link the IPv6 list to the end of the IPv4 list */
986 {
987 struct ifi_info **p = &intfList;
988 while (*p) p = &(*p)->ifi_next;
989 *p = get_ifi_info(AF_INET6, mDNStrue);
990 }
991#endif
992
993 if (err == 0)
994 {
995 struct ifi_info *i = intfList;
996 while (i)
997 {
998 if ( ((i->ifi_addr->sa_family == AF_INET)
999#if HAVE_IPV6
1000 || (i->ifi_addr->sa_family == AF_INET6)
1001#endif
1002 ) && (i->ifi_flags & IFF_UP) && !(i->ifi_flags & IFF_POINTOPOINT))
1003 {
1004 if (i->ifi_flags & IFF_LOOPBACK)
1005 {
1006 if (firstLoopback == NULL)
1007 firstLoopback = i;
1008 }
1009 else
1010 {
1011 if (SetupOneInterface(m, i->ifi_addr, i->ifi_netmask, i->ifi_name, i->ifi_index) == 0)
1012 if (i->ifi_addr->sa_family == AF_INET)
1013 foundav4 = mDNStrue;
1014 }
1015 }
1016 i = i->ifi_next;
1017 }
1018
1019 // If we found no normal interfaces but we did find a loopback interface, register the
1020 // loopback interface. This allows self-discovery if no interfaces are configured.
1021 // Temporary workaround: Multicast loopback on IPv6 interfaces appears not to work.
1022 // In the interim, we skip loopback interface only if we found at least one v4 interface to use
1023 // if ((m->HostInterfaces == NULL) && (firstLoopback != NULL))
1024 if (!foundav4 && firstLoopback)
1025 (void) SetupOneInterface(m, firstLoopback->ifi_addr, firstLoopback->ifi_netmask, firstLoopback->ifi_name, firstLoopback->ifi_index);
1026 }
1027
1028 // Clean up.
1029 if (intfList != NULL) free_ifi_info(intfList);
1030
1031 // Clean up any interfaces that have been hanging around on the RecentInterfaces list for more than a minute
1032 PosixNetworkInterface **ri = &gRecentInterfaces;
1033 const mDNSs32 utc = mDNSPlatformUTC();
1034 while (*ri)
1035 {
1036 PosixNetworkInterface *pi = *ri;
1037 if (utc - pi->LastSeen < 60) ri = (PosixNetworkInterface **)&pi->coreIntf.next;
1038 else { *ri = (PosixNetworkInterface *)pi->coreIntf.next; free(pi); }
1039 }
1040
1041 return err;
1042}
1043
1044#if USES_NETLINK
1045
1046// See <http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc3549.html> for a description of NetLink
1047
1048// Open a socket that will receive interface change notifications
1049mDNSlocal mStatus OpenIfNotifySocket(int *pFD)
1050{
1051 mStatus err = mStatus_NoError;
1052 struct sockaddr_nl snl;
1053 int sock;
1054 int ret;
1055
1056 sock = socket(AF_NETLINK, SOCK_RAW, NETLINK_ROUTE);
1057 if (sock < 0)
1058 return errno;
1059
1060 // Configure read to be non-blocking because inbound msg size is not known in advance
1061 (void) fcntl(sock, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
1062
1063 /* Subscribe the socket to Link & IP addr notifications. */
1064 mDNSPlatformMemZero(&snl, sizeof snl);
1065#ifndef NOT_HAVE_SA_LEN
1066 snl.nl_len = sizeof(snl);
1067#endif
1068 snl.nl_family = AF_NETLINK;
1069 snl.nl_groups = RTMGRP_LINK | RTMGRP_IPV4_IFADDR;
1070 ret = bind(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &snl, sizeof snl);
1071 if (0 == ret)
1072 *pFD = sock;
1073 else
1074 err = errno;
1075
1076 return err;
1077}
1078
1079#if MDNS_DEBUGMSGS
1080mDNSlocal void PrintNetLinkMsg(const struct nlmsghdr *pNLMsg)
1081{
1082 const char *kNLMsgTypes[] = { "", "NLMSG_NOOP", "NLMSG_ERROR", "NLMSG_DONE", "NLMSG_OVERRUN" };
1083 const char *kNLRtMsgTypes[] = { "RTM_NEWLINK", "RTM_DELLINK", "RTM_GETLINK", "RTM_NEWADDR", "RTM_DELADDR", "RTM_GETADDR" };
1084
1085 printf("nlmsghdr len=%d, type=%s, flags=0x%x\n", pNLMsg->nlmsg_len,
1086 pNLMsg->nlmsg_type < RTM_BASE ? kNLMsgTypes[pNLMsg->nlmsg_type] : kNLRtMsgTypes[pNLMsg->nlmsg_type - RTM_BASE],
1087 pNLMsg->nlmsg_flags);
1088
1089 if (RTM_NEWLINK <= pNLMsg->nlmsg_type && pNLMsg->nlmsg_type <= RTM_GETLINK)
1090 {
1091 struct ifinfomsg *pIfInfo = (struct ifinfomsg*) NLMSG_DATA(pNLMsg);
1092 printf("ifinfomsg family=%d, type=%d, index=%d, flags=0x%x, change=0x%x\n", pIfInfo->ifi_family,
1093 pIfInfo->ifi_type, pIfInfo->ifi_index, pIfInfo->ifi_flags, pIfInfo->ifi_change);
1094
1095 }
1096 else if (RTM_NEWADDR <= pNLMsg->nlmsg_type && pNLMsg->nlmsg_type <= RTM_GETADDR)
1097 {
1098 struct ifaddrmsg *pIfAddr = (struct ifaddrmsg*) NLMSG_DATA(pNLMsg);
1099 printf("ifaddrmsg family=%d, index=%d, flags=0x%x\n", pIfAddr->ifa_family,
1100 pIfAddr->ifa_index, pIfAddr->ifa_flags);
1101 }
1102 printf("\n");
1103}
1104#endif
1105
1106mDNSlocal mDNSu32 ProcessRoutingNotification(int sd)
1107// Read through the messages on sd and if any indicate that any interface records should
1108// be torn down and rebuilt, return affected indices as a bitmask. Otherwise return 0.
1109{
1110 ssize_t readCount;
1111 char buff[4096];
1112 struct nlmsghdr *pNLMsg = (struct nlmsghdr*) buff;
1113 mDNSu32 result = 0;
1114
1115 // The structure here is more complex than it really ought to be because,
1116 // unfortunately, there's no good way to size a buffer in advance large
1117 // enough to hold all pending data and so avoid message fragmentation.
1118 // (Note that FIONREAD is not supported on AF_NETLINK.)
1119
1120 readCount = read(sd, buff, sizeof buff);
1121 while (1)
1122 {
1123 // Make sure we've got an entire nlmsghdr in the buffer, and payload, too.
1124 // If not, discard already-processed messages in buffer and read more data.
1125 if (((char*) &pNLMsg[1] > (buff + readCount)) || // i.e. *pNLMsg extends off end of buffer
1126 ((char*) pNLMsg + pNLMsg->nlmsg_len > (buff + readCount)))
1127 {
1128 if (buff < (char*) pNLMsg) // we have space to shuffle
1129 {
1130 // discard processed data
1131 readCount -= ((char*) pNLMsg - buff);
1132 memmove(buff, pNLMsg, readCount);
1133 pNLMsg = (struct nlmsghdr*) buff;
1134
1135 // read more data
1136 readCount += read(sd, buff + readCount, sizeof buff - readCount);
1137 continue; // spin around and revalidate with new readCount
1138 }
1139 else
1140 break; // Otherwise message does not fit in buffer
1141 }
1142
1143#if MDNS_DEBUGMSGS
1144 PrintNetLinkMsg(pNLMsg);
1145#endif
1146
1147 // Process the NetLink message
1148 if (pNLMsg->nlmsg_type == RTM_GETLINK || pNLMsg->nlmsg_type == RTM_NEWLINK)
1149 result |= 1 << ((struct ifinfomsg*) NLMSG_DATA(pNLMsg))->ifi_index;
1150 else if (pNLMsg->nlmsg_type == RTM_DELADDR || pNLMsg->nlmsg_type == RTM_NEWADDR)
1151 result |= 1 << ((struct ifaddrmsg*) NLMSG_DATA(pNLMsg))->ifa_index;
1152
1153 // Advance pNLMsg to the next message in the buffer
1154 if ((pNLMsg->nlmsg_flags & NLM_F_MULTI) != 0 && pNLMsg->nlmsg_type != NLMSG_DONE)
1155 {
1156 ssize_t len = readCount - ((char*)pNLMsg - buff);
1157 pNLMsg = NLMSG_NEXT(pNLMsg, len);
1158 }
1159 else
1160 break; // all done!
1161 }
1162
1163 return result;
1164}
1165
1166#else // USES_NETLINK
1167
1168// Open a socket that will receive interface change notifications
1169mDNSlocal mStatus OpenIfNotifySocket(int *pFD)
1170{
1171 *pFD = socket(AF_ROUTE, SOCK_RAW, 0);
1172
1173 if (*pFD < 0)
1174 return mStatus_UnknownErr;
1175
1176 // Configure read to be non-blocking because inbound msg size is not known in advance
1177 (void) fcntl(*pFD, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
1178
1179 return mStatus_NoError;
1180}
1181
1182#if MDNS_DEBUGMSGS
1183mDNSlocal void PrintRoutingSocketMsg(const struct ifa_msghdr *pRSMsg)
1184{
1185 const char *kRSMsgTypes[] = { "", "RTM_ADD", "RTM_DELETE", "RTM_CHANGE", "RTM_GET", "RTM_LOSING",
1186 "RTM_REDIRECT", "RTM_MISS", "RTM_LOCK", "RTM_OLDADD", "RTM_OLDDEL", "RTM_RESOLVE",
1187 "RTM_NEWADDR", "RTM_DELADDR", "RTM_IFINFO", "RTM_NEWMADDR", "RTM_DELMADDR" };
1188
1189 int index = pRSMsg->ifam_type == RTM_IFINFO ? ((struct if_msghdr*) pRSMsg)->ifm_index : pRSMsg->ifam_index;
1190
1191 printf("ifa_msghdr len=%d, type=%s, index=%d\n", pRSMsg->ifam_msglen, kRSMsgTypes[pRSMsg->ifam_type], index);
1192}
1193#endif
1194
1195mDNSlocal mDNSu32 ProcessRoutingNotification(int sd)
1196// Read through the messages on sd and if any indicate that any interface records should
1197// be torn down and rebuilt, return affected indices as a bitmask. Otherwise return 0.
1198{
1199 ssize_t readCount;
1200 char buff[4096];
1201 struct ifa_msghdr *pRSMsg = (struct ifa_msghdr*) buff;
1202 mDNSu32 result = 0;
1203
1204 readCount = read(sd, buff, sizeof buff);
1205 if (readCount < (ssize_t) sizeof(struct ifa_msghdr))
1206 return mStatus_UnsupportedErr; // cannot decipher message
1207
1208#if MDNS_DEBUGMSGS
1209 PrintRoutingSocketMsg(pRSMsg);
1210#endif
1211
1212 // Process the message
1213 if (pRSMsg->ifam_type == RTM_NEWADDR || pRSMsg->ifam_type == RTM_DELADDR ||
1214 pRSMsg->ifam_type == RTM_IFINFO)
1215 {
1216 if (pRSMsg->ifam_type == RTM_IFINFO)
1217 result |= 1 << ((struct if_msghdr*) pRSMsg)->ifm_index;
1218 else
1219 result |= 1 << pRSMsg->ifam_index;
1220 }
1221
1222 return result;
1223}
1224
1225#endif // USES_NETLINK
1226
1227// Called when data appears on interface change notification socket
1228mDNSlocal void InterfaceChangeCallback(int fd, short filter, void *context)
1229{
1230 IfChangeRec *pChgRec = (IfChangeRec*) context;
1231 fd_set readFDs;
1232 mDNSu32 changedInterfaces = 0;
1233 struct timeval zeroTimeout = { 0, 0 };
1234
1235 (void)fd; // Unused
1236 (void)filter; // Unused
1237
1238 FD_ZERO(&readFDs);
1239 FD_SET(pChgRec->NotifySD, &readFDs);
1240
1241 do
1242 {
1243 changedInterfaces |= ProcessRoutingNotification(pChgRec->NotifySD);
1244 }
1245 while (0 < select(pChgRec->NotifySD + 1, &readFDs, (fd_set*) NULL, (fd_set*) NULL, &zeroTimeout));
1246
1247 // Currently we rebuild the entire interface list whenever any interface change is
1248 // detected. If this ever proves to be a performance issue in a multi-homed
1249 // configuration, more care should be paid to changedInterfaces.
1250 if (changedInterfaces)
1251 mDNSPlatformPosixRefreshInterfaceList(pChgRec->mDNS);
1252}
1253
1254// Register with either a Routing Socket or RtNetLink to listen for interface changes.
1255mDNSlocal mStatus WatchForInterfaceChange(mDNS *const m)
1256{
1257 mStatus err;
1258 IfChangeRec *pChgRec;
1259
1260 pChgRec = (IfChangeRec*) mDNSPlatformMemAllocate(sizeof *pChgRec);
1261 if (pChgRec == NULL)
1262 return mStatus_NoMemoryErr;
1263
1264 pChgRec->mDNS = m;
1265 err = OpenIfNotifySocket(&pChgRec->NotifySD);
1266 if (err == 0)
1267 err = mDNSPosixAddFDToEventLoop(pChgRec->NotifySD, InterfaceChangeCallback, pChgRec);
1268
1269 return err;
1270}
1271
1272// Test to see if we're the first client running on UDP port 5353, by trying to bind to 5353 without using SO_REUSEPORT.
1273// If we fail, someone else got here first. That's not a big problem; we can share the port for multicast responses --
1274// we just need to be aware that we shouldn't expect to successfully receive unicast UDP responses.
1275mDNSlocal mDNSBool mDNSPlatformInit_CanReceiveUnicast(void)
1276{
1277 int err;
1278 int s = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
1279 struct sockaddr_in s5353;
1280
1281 mDNSPlatformMemZero(&s5353, sizeof(s5353));
1282#ifndef NOT_HAVE_SA_LEN
1283 s5353.sin_len = sizeof(s5353);
1284#endif
1285 s5353.sin_family = AF_INET;
1286 s5353.sin_port = MulticastDNSPort.NotAnInteger;
1287 s5353.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
1288 err = bind(s, (struct sockaddr *)&s5353, sizeof(s5353));
1289 close(s);
1290 if (err) debugf("No unicast UDP responses");
1291 else debugf("Unicast UDP responses okay");
1292 return(err == 0);
1293}
1294
1295// mDNS core calls this routine to initialise the platform-specific data.
1296mDNSexport mStatus mDNSPlatformInit(mDNS *const m)
1297{
1298 int err = 0;
1299 struct sockaddr sa;
1300 assert(m != NULL);
1301
1302 if (mDNSPlatformInit_CanReceiveUnicast()) m->CanReceiveUnicastOn5353 = mDNStrue;
1303
1304 // Tell mDNS core the names of this machine.
1305
1306 // Set up the nice label
1307 m->nicelabel.c[0] = 0;
1308 GetUserSpecifiedFriendlyComputerName(&m->nicelabel);
1309 if (m->nicelabel.c[0] == 0) MakeDomainLabelFromLiteralString(&m->nicelabel, "Computer");
1310
1311 // Set up the RFC 1034-compliant label
1312 m->hostlabel.c[0] = 0;
1313 GetUserSpecifiedRFC1034ComputerName(&m->hostlabel);
1314 if (m->hostlabel.c[0] == 0) MakeDomainLabelFromLiteralString(&m->hostlabel, "Computer");
1315
1316 mDNS_SetFQDN(m);
1317
1318 sa.sa_family = AF_INET;
1319 m->p->unicastSocket4 = -1;
1320 if (err == mStatus_NoError) err = SetupSocket(&sa, zeroIPPort, 0, &m->p->unicastSocket4);
1321#if HAVE_IPV6
1322 sa.sa_family = AF_INET6;
1323 m->p->unicastSocket6 = -1;
1324 if (err == mStatus_NoError) err = SetupSocket(&sa, zeroIPPort, 0, &m->p->unicastSocket6);
1325#endif
1326
1327 // Tell mDNS core about the network interfaces on this machine.
1328 if (err == mStatus_NoError) err = SetupInterfaceList(m);
1329
1330 // Tell mDNS core about DNS Servers
1331 mDNS_Lock(m);
1332 if (err == mStatus_NoError) ParseDNSServers(m, uDNS_SERVERS_FILE);
1333 mDNS_Unlock(m);
1334
1335 if (err == mStatus_NoError)
1336 {
1337 err = WatchForInterfaceChange(m);
1338 // Failure to observe interface changes is non-fatal.
1339 if (err != mStatus_NoError)
1340 {
1341 fprintf(stderr, "mDNS(%d) WARNING: Unable to detect interface changes (%d).\n", getpid(), err);
1342 err = mStatus_NoError;
1343 }
1344 }
1345
1346 // We don't do asynchronous initialization on the Posix platform, so by the time
1347 // we get here the setup will already have succeeded or failed. If it succeeded,
1348 // we should just call mDNSCoreInitComplete() immediately.
1349 if (err == mStatus_NoError)
1350 mDNSCoreInitComplete(m, mStatus_NoError);
1351
1352 return PosixErrorToStatus(err);
1353}
1354
1355// mDNS core calls this routine to clean up the platform-specific data.
1356// In our case all we need to do is to tear down every network interface.
1357mDNSexport void mDNSPlatformClose(mDNS *const m)
1358{
1359 int rv;
1360 assert(m != NULL);
1361 ClearInterfaceList(m);
1362 if (m->p->unicastSocket4 != -1)
1363 {
1364 rv = close(m->p->unicastSocket4);
1365 assert(rv == 0);
1366 }
1367#if HAVE_IPV6
1368 if (m->p->unicastSocket6 != -1)
1369 {
1370 rv = close(m->p->unicastSocket6);
1371 assert(rv == 0);
1372 }
1373#endif
1374}
1375
1376// This is used internally by InterfaceChangeCallback.
1377// It's also exported so that the Standalone Responder (mDNSResponderPosix)
1378// can call it in response to a SIGHUP (mainly for debugging purposes).
1379mDNSexport mStatus mDNSPlatformPosixRefreshInterfaceList(mDNS *const m)
1380{
1381 int err;
1382 // This is a pretty heavyweight way to process interface changes --
1383 // destroying the entire interface list and then making fresh one from scratch.
1384 // We should make it like the OS X version, which leaves unchanged interfaces alone.
1385 ClearInterfaceList(m);
1386 err = SetupInterfaceList(m);
1387 return PosixErrorToStatus(err);
1388}

1390#if COMPILER_LIKES_PRAGMA_MARK
1391#pragma mark ***** Locking
1392#endif

1394// On the Posix platform, locking is a no-op because we only ever enter
1395// mDNS core on the main thread.
1396
1397// mDNS core calls this routine when it wants to prevent
1398// the platform from reentering mDNS core code.
1399mDNSexport void mDNSPlatformLock (const mDNS *const m)
1400{
1401 (void) m; // Unused
1402}
1403
1404// mDNS core calls this routine when it release the lock taken by
1405// mDNSPlatformLock and allow the platform to reenter mDNS core code.
1406mDNSexport void mDNSPlatformUnlock (const mDNS *const m)
1407{
1408 (void) m; // Unused
1409}

1411#if COMPILER_LIKES_PRAGMA_MARK
1412#pragma mark ***** Strings
1413#endif

1415// mDNS core calls this routine to copy C strings.
1416// On the Posix platform this maps directly to the ANSI C strcpy.
1417mDNSexport void mDNSPlatformStrCopy(void *dst, const void *src)
1418{
1419 strcpy((char *)dst, (const char *)src);
1420}
1421
1422mDNSexport mDNSu32 mDNSPlatformStrLCopy(void *dst, const void *src, mDNSu32 len)
1423{
1424#if HAVE_STRLCPY
1425 return ((mDNSu32)strlcpy((char *)dst, (const char *)src, len));
1426#else
1427 size_t srcLen;
1428
1429 srcLen = strlen((const char *)src);
1430 if (srcLen < len)
1431 {
1432 memcpy(dst, src, srcLen + 1);
1433 }
1434 else if (len > 0)
1435 {
1436 memcpy(dst, src, len - 1);
1437 ((char *)dst)[len - 1] = '\0';
1438 }
1439
1440 return ((mDNSu32)srcLen);
1441#endif
1442}
1443
1444// mDNS core calls this routine to get the length of a C string.
1445// On the Posix platform this maps directly to the ANSI C strlen.
1446mDNSexport mDNSu32 mDNSPlatformStrLen (const void *src)
1447{
1448 return strlen((const char*)src);
1449}

1452// On the Posix platform this maps directly to the ANSI C memcpy.
1453mDNSexport void mDNSPlatformMemCopy(void *dst, const void *src, mDNSu32 len)
1454{
1455 memcpy(dst, src, len);
1456}
1457
1458// mDNS core calls this routine to test whether blocks of memory are byte-for-byte
1459// identical. On the Posix platform this is a simple wrapper around ANSI C memcmp.
1460mDNSexport mDNSBool mDNSPlatformMemSame(const void *dst, const void *src, mDNSu32 len)
1461{
1462 return memcmp(dst, src, len) == 0;
1463}
1464
1465// If the caller wants to know the exact return of memcmp, then use this instead
1466// of mDNSPlatformMemSame
1467mDNSexport int mDNSPlatformMemCmp(const void *dst, const void *src, mDNSu32 len)
1468{
1469 return (memcmp(dst, src, len));
1470}

1547
1548mDNSexport mDNSs32 mDNSPlatformOneSecond = 1024;
1549
1550mDNSexport mStatus mDNSPlatformTimeInit(void)
1551{
1552 // No special setup is required on Posix -- we just use gettimeofday();
1553 // This is not really safe, because gettimeofday can go backwards if the user manually changes the date or time
1554 // We should find a better way to do this
1555 return(mStatus_NoError);
1556}
1557
1558mDNSexport mDNSs32 mDNSPlatformRawTime()
1559{
1560#ifdef CLOCK_MONOTONIC
1561 struct timespec tv;
1562 clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &tv);
1563 return((tv.tv_sec << 10) | ((tv.tv_nsec / 1000) * 16 / 15625));
1564#else
1565 struct timeval tv;
1566 gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
1567 // tv.tv_sec is seconds since 1st January 1970 (GMT, with no adjustment for daylight savings time)
1568 // tv.tv_usec is microseconds since the start of this second (i.e. values 0 to 999999)
1569 // We use the lower 22 bits of tv.tv_sec for the top 22 bits of our result
1570 // and we multiply tv.tv_usec by 16 / 15625 to get a value in the range 0-1023 to go in the bottom 10 bits.
1571 // This gives us a proper modular (cyclic) counter that has a resolution of roughly 1ms (actually 1/1024 second)
1572 // and correctly cycles every 2^22 seconds (4194304 seconds = approx 48 days).
1573 return((tv.tv_sec << 10) | (tv.tv_usec * 16 / 15625));
1574#endif
1575}
1576
1577mDNSexport mDNSs32 mDNSPlatformUTC(void)
1578{
1579 return time(NULL);
1580}

1689
1690mDNSlocal void mDNSPosixAddToFDSet(int *nfds, fd_set *readfds, int s)
1691{
1692 if (*nfds < s + 1) *nfds = s + 1;
1693 FD_SET(s, readfds);
1694}
1695
1696mDNSexport void mDNSPosixGetFDSet(mDNS *m, int *nfds, fd_set *readfds, struct timeval *timeout)
1697{
1698 mDNSs32 ticks;
1699 struct timeval interval;
1700
1701 // 1. Call mDNS_Execute() to let mDNSCore do what it needs to do
1702 mDNSs32 nextevent = mDNS_Execute(m);
1703
1704 // 2. Build our list of active file descriptors
1705 PosixNetworkInterface *info = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(m->HostInterfaces);
1706 if (m->p->unicastSocket4 != -1) mDNSPosixAddToFDSet(nfds, readfds, m->p->unicastSocket4);
1707#if HAVE_IPV6
1708 if (m->p->unicastSocket6 != -1) mDNSPosixAddToFDSet(nfds, readfds, m->p->unicastSocket6);
1709#endif
1710 while (info)
1711 {
1712 if (info->multicastSocket4 != -1) mDNSPosixAddToFDSet(nfds, readfds, info->multicastSocket4);
1713#if HAVE_IPV6
1714 if (info->multicastSocket6 != -1) mDNSPosixAddToFDSet(nfds, readfds, info->multicastSocket6);
1715#endif
1716 info = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(info->coreIntf.next);
1717 }
1718
1719 // 3. Calculate the time remaining to the next scheduled event (in struct timeval format)
1720 ticks = nextevent - mDNS_TimeNow(m);
1721 if (ticks < 1) ticks = 1;
1722 interval.tv_sec = ticks >> 10; // The high 22 bits are seconds
1723 interval.tv_usec = ((ticks & 0x3FF) * 15625) / 16; // The low 10 bits are 1024ths
1724
1725 // 4. If client's proposed timeout is more than what we want, then reduce it
1726 if (timeout->tv_sec > interval.tv_sec ||
1727 (timeout->tv_sec == interval.tv_sec && timeout->tv_usec > interval.tv_usec))
1728 *timeout = interval;
1729}
1730
1731mDNSexport void mDNSPosixProcessFDSet(mDNS *const m, fd_set *readfds)
1732{
1733 PosixNetworkInterface *info;
1734 assert(m != NULL);
1735 assert(readfds != NULL);
1736 info = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(m->HostInterfaces);
1737
1738 if (m->p->unicastSocket4 != -1 && FD_ISSET(m->p->unicastSocket4, readfds))
1739 {
1740 FD_CLR(m->p->unicastSocket4, readfds);
1741 SocketDataReady(m, NULL, m->p->unicastSocket4);
1742 }
1743#if HAVE_IPV6
1744 if (m->p->unicastSocket6 != -1 && FD_ISSET(m->p->unicastSocket6, readfds))
1745 {
1746 FD_CLR(m->p->unicastSocket6, readfds);
1747 SocketDataReady(m, NULL, m->p->unicastSocket6);
1748 }
1749#endif
1750
1751 while (info)
1752 {
1753 if (info->multicastSocket4 != -1 && FD_ISSET(info->multicastSocket4, readfds))
1754 {
1755 FD_CLR(info->multicastSocket4, readfds);
1756 SocketDataReady(m, info, info->multicastSocket4);
1757 }
1758#if HAVE_IPV6
1759 if (info->multicastSocket6 != -1 && FD_ISSET(info->multicastSocket6, readfds))
1760 {
1761 FD_CLR(info->multicastSocket6, readfds);
1762 SocketDataReady(m, info, info->multicastSocket6);
1763 }
1764#endif
1765 info = (PosixNetworkInterface *)(info->coreIntf.next);
1766 }
1767}
1768
1769// update gMaxFD
1770mDNSlocal void DetermineMaxEventFD(void)
1771{
1772 PosixEventSource *iSource;
1773
1774 gMaxFD = 0;
1775 for (iSource=(PosixEventSource*)gEventSources.Head; iSource; iSource = iSource->Next)
1776 if (gMaxFD < iSource->fd)
1777 gMaxFD = iSource->fd;
1778}
1779
1780// Add a file descriptor to the set that mDNSPosixRunEventLoopOnce() listens to.
1781mStatus mDNSPosixAddFDToEventLoop(int fd, mDNSPosixEventCallback callback, void *context)
1782{
1783 PosixEventSource *newSource;
1784
1785 if (gEventSources.LinkOffset == 0)
1786 InitLinkedList(&gEventSources, offsetof(PosixEventSource, Next));
1787
1788 if (fd >= (int) FD_SETSIZE || fd < 0)
1789 return mStatus_UnsupportedErr;
1790 if (callback == NULL)
1791 return mStatus_BadParamErr;
1792
1793 newSource = (PosixEventSource*) malloc(sizeof *newSource);
1794 if (NULL == newSource)
1795 return mStatus_NoMemoryErr;
1796
1797 newSource->Callback = callback;
1798 newSource->Context = context;
1799 newSource->fd = fd;
1800
1801 AddToTail(&gEventSources, newSource);
1802 FD_SET(fd, &gEventFDs);
1803
1804 DetermineMaxEventFD();
1805
1806 return mStatus_NoError;
1807}
1808
1809// Remove a file descriptor from the set that mDNSPosixRunEventLoopOnce() listens to.
1810mStatus mDNSPosixRemoveFDFromEventLoop(int fd)
1811{
1812 PosixEventSource *iSource;
1813
1814 for (iSource=(PosixEventSource*)gEventSources.Head; iSource; iSource = iSource->Next)
1815 {
1816 if (fd == iSource->fd)
1817 {
1818 FD_CLR(fd, &gEventFDs);
1819 RemoveFromList(&gEventSources, iSource);
1820 free(iSource);
1821 DetermineMaxEventFD();
1822 return mStatus_NoError;
1823 }
1824 }
1825 return mStatus_NoSuchNameErr;
1826}
1827
1828// Simply note the received signal in gEventSignals.
1829mDNSlocal void NoteSignal(int signum)
1830{
1831 sigaddset(&gEventSignals, signum);
1832}
1833
1834// Tell the event package to listen for signal and report it in mDNSPosixRunEventLoopOnce().
1835mStatus mDNSPosixListenForSignalInEventLoop(int signum)
1836{
1837 struct sigaction action;
1838 mStatus err;
1839
1840 mDNSPlatformMemZero(&action, sizeof action); // more portable than member-wise assignment
1841 action.sa_handler = NoteSignal;
1842 err = sigaction(signum, &action, (struct sigaction*) NULL);
1843
1844 sigaddset(&gEventSignalSet, signum);
1845
1846 return err;
1847}
1848
1849// Tell the event package to stop listening for signal in mDNSPosixRunEventLoopOnce().
1850mStatus mDNSPosixIgnoreSignalInEventLoop(int signum)
1851{
1852 struct sigaction action;
1853 mStatus err;
1854
1855 mDNSPlatformMemZero(&action, sizeof action); // more portable than member-wise assignment
1856 action.sa_handler = SIG_DFL;
1857 err = sigaction(signum, &action, (struct sigaction*) NULL);
1858
1859 sigdelset(&gEventSignalSet, signum);
1860
1861 return err;
1862}
1863
1864// Do a single pass through the attendent event sources and dispatch any found to their callbacks.
1865// Return as soon as internal timeout expires, or a signal we're listening for is received.
1866mStatus mDNSPosixRunEventLoopOnce(mDNS *m, const struct timeval *pTimeout,
1867 sigset_t *pSignalsReceived, mDNSBool *pDataDispatched)
1868{
1869 fd_set listenFDs = gEventFDs;
1870 int fdMax = 0, numReady;
1871 struct timeval timeout = *pTimeout;
1872
1873 // Include the sockets that are listening to the wire in our select() set
1874 mDNSPosixGetFDSet(m, &fdMax, &listenFDs, &timeout); // timeout may get modified
1875 if (fdMax < gMaxFD)
1876 fdMax = gMaxFD;
1877
1878 numReady = select(fdMax + 1, &listenFDs, (fd_set*) NULL, (fd_set*) NULL, &timeout);
1879
1880 // If any data appeared, invoke its callback
1881 if (numReady > 0)
1882 {
1883 PosixEventSource *iSource;
1884
1885 (void) mDNSPosixProcessFDSet(m, &listenFDs); // call this first to process wire data for clients
1886
1887 for (iSource=(PosixEventSource*)gEventSources.Head; iSource; iSource = iSource->Next)
1888 {
1889 if (FD_ISSET(iSource->fd, &listenFDs))
1890 {
1891 iSource->Callback(iSource->fd, 0, iSource->Context);
1892 break; // in case callback removed elements from gEventSources
1893 }
1894 }
1895 *pDataDispatched = mDNStrue;
1896 }
1897 else
1898 *pDataDispatched = mDNSfalse;
1899
1900 (void) sigprocmask(SIG_BLOCK, &gEventSignalSet, (sigset_t*) NULL);
1901 *pSignalsReceived = gEventSignals;
1902 sigemptyset(&gEventSignals);
1903 (void) sigprocmask(SIG_UNBLOCK, &gEventSignalSet, (sigset_t*) NULL);
1904
1905 return mStatus_NoError;
1906}
